stimulusHtml: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the map?

features.html:
• The map shows:
    • The population density of regions throughout the continent of Africa and the island of Madagascar, measured as follows:
      • fewer than 25 persons per square mile or fewer than 10 persons per square kilometer
      • between 25 and 195 persons per square mile or between 10 and 75 persons per square kilometer
      • between 195 and 520 persons per square mile or between 75 and 200 persons per square kilometer
      • over 520 persons per square mile or over 200 persons per square kilometer
    • Cities with population over 1,000,000 persons
    • The Atlantic Ocean to the west
    • The Gulf of Guinea to the south of western Africa
    • Unidentified rivers
  • From north to south, the population density is shown as follows:
    • Cities are identified by name and a general description of their location.
    • Northern Africa:
      • The following 4 cities have over 1,000,000 persons:
        • Casablanca (western coast)
        • Algiers (northern coast)
        • Alexandria (northern coast, on a river)
        • Cairo (inland, on a river)
      • Areas with a population density of over 520 persons per square mile or over 200 persons per square kilometer are near the cities and along the banks of the river that goes through Alexandria and Cairo.
      • Most of inland northern Africa has a population density of fewer than 25 persons per square mile or fewer than 10 persons per square kilometer.
  • Western Africa:
    • The following 6 cities have over 1,000,000 persons:
      • Dakar (western coast)
      • Conakry (western coast)
      • Abidjan (Gulf of Guinea coast)
      • Lagos (Gulf of Guinea coast)
      • Ibadan (Gulf of Guinea coast)
      • Douala (Gulf of Guinea coast)
    • Areas with a population density of over 520 persons per square mile or over 200 persons per square kilometer:
      • Most are near the cities.
      • One is inland and near no rivers.
    • Most of western Africa has a population density of between 25 and 195 persons per square mile or 10 and 75 persons per square kilometer.
  • Eastern Africa:
    • The following 3 cities have over 1,000,000 persons:
      • Addis-Ababa (inland, on a river)
      • Nairobi (inland)
      • Dar es Salaam (eastern coast)
    • Areas with a population density of between 195 persons per square mile or 75 persons per square kilometer and over 520 persons per square mile or over 200 persons per square kilometer are near the cities and near a large lake.
    • Most of eastern Africa has a population density of fewer than 195 persons per square mile or fewer than 75 persons per square kilometer.
  • Central Africa:
    • The following 4 cities have over 1,000,000 persons:
      • Kinshasa (inland, on a river)
      • Luanda (western coast)
      • Lusaka (inland)
      • Harare (inland)
    • Most of central Africa has a population density of fewer than 195 persons per square mile or fewer than 75 persons per square kilometer.
  • Southern Africa:
    • Areas with a population density of fewer than 25 persons per square mile or fewer than 10 persons per square kilometer are in the west.
    • Areas with a population density of between 25 and 195 persons per square mile or 10 and 75 persons per square kilometer are in the east.
  • Madagascar:
    • Areas with a population density of fewer than 25 persons per square mile or fewer than 10 persons per square kilometer are in the west.
    • Areas with a population density of between 25 and 195 persons per square mile or 10 and 75 persons per square kilometer are in the east.

choicesHtml: The Congo River near Kinshasa supports a larger population than all other rivers in Africa.
The highest population densities in Africa are consistently located where rivers meet the ocean.
There is a large population along the Nile River in the area around Cairo.
Population density is consistently the highest along the Atlantic coast.
